headline.print_headline: Threat of Russian Hooliganism Looms Over Championships
headline.seo: Euro 2012: Russian Hooliganism Looms Over Soccer Tournament
headline.main: Threat of Russian Hooliganism Looms Over Championships

docs.snippet: The Russia soccer federation asked its fans to show restraint ahead of Saturday’s game with Greece. Clashes between Polish and Russian fans on Tuesday caused property damage and injuries....
docs.abstract: Russian soccer federation asks its fans to show restraint ahead of the game with Greece, after clashes between Polish and Russian fans caused property damage and injuries in an earlier match at the European championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Russia soccer federation asked its fans to show restraint ahead of Saturday’s game with Greece. Clashes between Polish and Russian fans on Tuesday caused property damage and injuries.

headline.seo: Ukraine’s President Says He Has No Authority to Pardon Tymoshenko
headline.main: Ukraine’s President Says He Has No Authority to Pardon Jailed Rival

docs.snippet: In an interview with Time magazine, President Viktor F. Yanukovich says he wants to release former Prime Minister Yulia V. Tymoshenko, but “can’t act outside the framework of the law.”...
docs.abstract: Ukraine Pres Viktor F Yanukovich, in an interview with Time magazine, says he wants to release former prime minister Yulia V Tymoshenko from prison, but does not have the legal authority to do so.
docs.lead_paragraph: In an interview with Time magazine, President Viktor F. Yanukovich says he wants to release former Prime Minister Yulia V. Tymoshenko, but “can’t act outside the framework of the law.”

headline.print_headline: A Slow Recovery in the United States, but It’s All Relative
headline.seo: A Slow Recovery, but It’s All Relative
headline.main: A Slow Recovery in the United States, but It’s All Relative

docs.snippet: Compared with the economies of other industrialized countries, the United States economy has done rather well since the depths of 2008. Only the Canadian economy has done better....
docs.abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column compares the recovery of the United States economy since the 2008 fiscal crisis against the euro zone and Group of 7 nations, arguing that it has largely outperformed most other countries; notes that the economy, adjusted for inflation, was 1.2 percent larger in the first quarter of 2012 than it was in the peak quarter before the recession.
docs.lead_paragraph: Compared with the economies of other industrialized countries, the United States economy has done rather well since the depths of 2008. Only the Canadian economy has done better.

headline.print_headline: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.seo: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.main: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid

docs.snippet: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs....

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Supreme Court ruling on the new health care law will have vast implications for Medicaid and the 250,000 people who will benefit from the expansion of the program in Arkansas alone; state officials everywhere worry about the costs associated with expanding Medicaid programs, and one of the aspects of the law that the Supreme Court is deliberating on is the ability of Congress to attach conditions to money it distributes to states.
docs.lead_paragraph: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs.

headline.print_headline: Norway Has Noir; Just Ask Jo Nesbo
headline.seo: Jo Nesbo, Crime Writer From Norway, Visits U.S.
headline.main: Norway Has Noir; Just Ask Jo Nesbo

docs.snippet: Jo Nesbo, the crime writer being compared in the United States to Stieg Larsson, had his hair cut, put on a suit and met with booksellers and journalists at Book Expo America last week....
docs.abstract: Jo Nesbo, the Norwegian crime writer often compared to Stieg Larsson, visits the BookExpo America conference in New York to promote his latest novel Phantom.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jo Nesbo, the crime writer being compared in the United States to Stieg Larsson, had his hair cut, put on a suit and met with booksellers and journalists at Book Expo America last week.

headline.print_headline: Richard F. Stolz, 86, Chief Of C.I.A. Spy Operations
headline.seo: Richard F. Stolz Dies at 86; Headed C.I.A. Spy Operations After Iran-Contra
headline.main: Richard F. Stolz Dies at 86; Headed C.I.A. Spy Operations After Iran-Contra

docs.snippet: Mr. Stolz, who had retired from the agency in 1981 after failing to get a deputy director post, was called back to help repair its image....
docs.abstract: Richard F Stolz, former chief of Central Intelligence Agency spy operations, dies at age 86.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Stolz, who had retired from the agency in 1981 after failing to get a deputy director post, was called back to help repair its image.

headline.print_headline: In Euro Crisis, Obama Looks to Merkel
headline.seo: In Euro Crisis, Obama Tries to Build on Rapport With Merkel
headline.main: In Euro Crisis, Obama Looks to Merkel

docs.snippet: A collapse of the euro could derail America’s fragile recovery and doom Mr. Obama’s re-election hopes. He may be running out of time to sway the German chancellor....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama's relationship with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is perhaps the best he has had with any foreign leader, but he has yet to persuade her to agree to an American-style bailout and fiscal stimulus; the two will meet again at a Group of 20 summit in Mexico.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin.

docs.lead_paragraph: A collapse of the euro could derail America’s fragile recovery and doom Mr. Obama’s re-election hopes. He may be running out of time to sway the German chancellor.

headline.print_headline: In Duel of Stars, Heat’s James Gains an Early Edge
headline.seo: In Duel of Stars, Heat’s LeBron James Gains an Early Edge
headline.main: In Duel of Stars, Heat’s James Gains Early Edge

docs.snippet: LeBron James and Kevin Durant have played to a virtual statistical tie in the first two games of the N.B.A. finals, but the Heat got the split they wanted in Oklahoma City....
docs.lead_paragraph: LeBron James and Kevin Durant have played to a virtual statistical tie in the first two games of the N.B.A. finals, but the Heat got the split they wanted in Oklahoma City.

headline.print_headline: Studies Find That Gossip Isn’t Just Loose Talk
headline.seo: Studies Find Gossip Isn’t Just Loose Talk
headline.main: Studies Find That Gossip Isn’t Just Loose Talk

docs.snippet: Not all gossip is bad, according to researchers, who say it can be useful in maintaining social norms and keeping people in line....

keywords.value: Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Studies published in the The Journal of Personality and Social Psychology and journal Social Psychological and Personality Science indicate that gossip, usually thought of negatively, is useful in maintaining social norms and pressuring individuals to behave acceptably.
docs.lead_paragraph: Not all gossip is bad, according to researchers, who say it can be useful in maintaining social norms and keeping people in line.

headline.print_headline: In Investments, As in Life, Passion Can Cloud Judgment
headline.seo: In Investments, as in Life, Passion Can Cloud Judgment
headline.main: In Investments, as in Life, Passion Can Cloud Judgment

docs.snippet: A study finds that even successful business owners can make poor decisions when it comes to so-called passion investments like vineyards, baseball teams and racehorses....
docs.abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column contends that investors are often reluctant to sell their stakes in passion investments; cites study from Barclays Wealth and Investment Management that points out the risks of emotional investing.
docs.lead_paragraph: A study finds that even successful business owners can make poor decisions when it comes to so-called passion investments like vineyards, baseball teams and racehorses.
